subject: Writing
title: Gutenberg's Press: The Information Bomb
description: A fast breakdown of Gutenberg's Press: The Information Bomb for builders.

hook.text: Johannes Gutenberg went bankrupt inventing the printing press. Then his invention changed human history forever.

buildup.text: Around 1440, Gutenberg combined movable metal type, oil-based ink, and a modified wine press into a printing system.

discovery.text: His first major print was the Gutenberg Bible â€” 180 copies that took three years. A monk needed 15 years for one.

twist.text: Gutenberg's business partner sued him and seized his press. The inventor died in poverty while his invention thrived.

climax.text: Within 50 years, 20 million books were in circulation. Knowledge was no longer controlled by monks and kings.

punchline.text: One bankrupt goldsmith accidentally started the information age.
